alert.note: Alert for Northern Oxford; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 23 at 3:17AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .An ice jam may cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of western Maine, including the following areas, Northern Oxford and Southern Oxford. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Northern Carroll, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll, Southern Coos, Southern Grafton and Sullivan. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations due to ice jams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall will combine with rapid snowmelt today to cause rises on area rivers. In addition, pre-existing ice jams will be focus areas for flooding as river rises cause flooding of low-lying areas. Rivers will continue to rise through the day, before peaking later tonight. The additional rises along with weakening river ice could lead to additional ice break- up and possible ice jam flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
